content: with both its wraps when you have worked enough tiers to reach your desired leg length proceed to the heel heel row 1 rs k31/35 wrap next st turn row 2 ws p30/34 wrap next st turn broken jack page 4 proceed like this working one st less each row until your last row ws is p12 wrap next st turn if you prefer or need a pointier heel work until you p10 sts for the second part of the heel work one st more each row as follows row 1 rs k13 wrap next st giving this st its second wrap turn row 2 ws p14 wrap next st giving this st its second wrap turn continue working one st more each row until there is only one st unworked and wrapped at either side ending after a ws row turn k 31/35 wrap next st this st will be on the next needle as it belongs to the instep of your sock turn p32/36 wrap next st again this st will be on the next needle turn k32/36 you are now at the beginning of your first foot tier the foot tiers are worked exactly as the leg tiers please note that the very first st you start the first triangle with will have two wraps on it that you will have to hide work enough tiers to achieve the required foot length you will need to leave 2 inches/2 ½ inches off your total foot length for the toe so stop when you cannot fit in another tier and work in the round over all 64/72 sts until you are 2 /2 ½ short of your desired foot length toe for size l 72 sts only k7 k2tog 8 times 64 sts k 6 rounds both sizes k6 k2tog 8 times 56 sts k 5 rounds k5 k2tog 8 times 48 sts k 4 rounds k4 k2tog 8 times 40 sts k 3 rounds k3 k2tog 8 times 32 sts k 2 rounds k2 k2tog 8 times 24 sts k 1 round k1 k2tog 8 times 16 sts k2tog 8 times 8 sts cut yarn with around 6 inches left graft toe closed alternatively you could just pull the yarn to all 8 sts twice and pull tight sew in yarn ends on the inside and proceed to your second sock broken jack page 5 schematic order for working the triangle tiers broken jack page 6
